description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Windows Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS) remote code execution vulnerability identified by CVE-2024-30023:

1. Apply the relevant KB article updates corresponding to your version of Windows:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: Download and install KB5037771 from [here](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771).
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: Download and install KB5037771 from [here](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037771).
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: Download and install KB5037770 from [here](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037770).
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: Download and install KB5037768 from [here](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768).
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: Download and install KB5037768 from [here](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5037768).
   - For Windows 10 Version 20H2 and earlier, updates may vary, refer to the catalog links.

**Details**:
- This update addresses a numeric truncation error that introduces a remote code execution risk within the RRAS. Updating your system will strengthen your defenses against exploits leveraging this vulnerability.
- Ensure your system matches the specific build number to avoid compatibility issues.

**Preconditions**:
- Backup any critical data before proceeding with the updates to prevent data loss in case of installation issues.
